channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: China's largest ride-hailing company now asks customers to rate the aroma
item.description: China's ride-hailing companies are penalizing drivers for smelly rides. A surplus of labor means many drivers work 15 hours a day and live in their cars to make ends meet, hence the odor.

item.title: To a survivor of Japanese incarceration, ICE detentions feel painfully familiar
item.description: Mary Murakami was 14 years old when she was forcibly relocated and imprisoned during World War II. The Trump Administration's immigration enforcement actions resurface painful memories.

item.title: Trump's announcement of a steep fee hike to H1-B visa sparks confusion in India
item.description: President Trump announced a $100,000 fee hike to a visa category overwhelmingly used by Indian nationals to work in tech. it's causing confusion and concern in India.

item.title: Remembering Sonny Curtis, singer and 'Mary Tyler Moore Show' theme song writer
item.description: Prolific singer and songwriter Sonny Curtis has died. He wrote and performed "Love Is All Around," the theme song for The Mary Tyler Moore Show.

item.title: Experts alarmed by Trump plan to force homeless Americans into institutions
item.description: President Trump wants far more homeless people forced into mandatory long-term addiction or mental health treatment but critics say forcing people to accept care is risky and expensive.

item.title: Trump issues executive order designating antifa a 'domestic terrorist organization'
item.description: President Trump has issued an order designating antifa a "domestic terrorist organization," as he has long promised. It sets a precedent and is prompting many questions.

item.title: Despite past complications, crypto company Tether is ready for American debut
item.description: Global crypto giant Tether has a controversial history but it now has an ambitious plan to expand across the U.S. It's a sign of how much things have changed for crypto under President Trump.

item.title: What's long COVID like? Novelist says it gave her 'Brian fog' — That's not a typo
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with author Patricia Lockwood about her latest novel Will There Ever Be Another You. She spent years fighting long COVID and her book captures that sense of disorientation.

item.title: The 'dark patterns' at the center of FTC's lawsuit against Amazon
item.description: This week, the trial starts in a consequential FTC lawsuit against Amazon. The suit alleges that Amazon for years "tricked" people into buying Prime memberships that were purposefully hard to cancel.

item.title: Want a seat at this synagogue for the High Holidays? You have to register to vote first
item.description: A Brooklyn synagogue has taken an unusual step by requiring congregants to show proof of voter registration in order to secure seats for High Holidays. Their biggest concern? The city's mayoral seat.
